unnormalised: Honestly, for me, it's all about finding that little pocket of calm in the chaos. My days are usually a whirlwind – juggling work, family drama (typical in any good Indian household!), and trying to fit in time for, well, me.
normalised: Honestly, for me, it is all about finding that little pocket of calm in the chaos. My days are usually a whirlwind – juggling work, family drama (typical in any good Indian household!), and trying to fit in time for, well, me.

unnormalised: I swear, ever since I started incorporating even a short yoga practice into my routine, things have become noticeably more manageable. Nothing too strenuous, mind you. It usually starts with a few rounds of Surya Namaskar (Sun Salutations) – just feels right, doesn't it? Then, I move into some simple asanas like Trikonasana (Triangle Pose) and Virabhadrasana (Warrior Pose) to stretch out all the tension I accumulate hunching over my laptop all day.

unnormalised: Remember that scene in "3 Idiots" when Rancho encourages everyone to say "All is well"? Yoga kind of gives me that feeling, but from the inside out.

unnormalised: The Sivananda Yoga Vedanta Dhanwantari Ashram's online classes were a total game changer during the lockdown. They offer different levels, so you can find something that suits your fitness level. I especially enjoy their focus on breathing techniques (pranayama). A few minutes of Nadi Shodhana (Alternate Nostril Breathing) and I feel like I can conquer anything – even my mother's constant questions about when I'm getting married! Seriously though, even 15-20 minutes of yoga makes a world of difference. What are your favorite practices for de-stressing? Would love to hear your tips!
